issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Is not a bug in our product
resolution.name: Not Our Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Push notifications to Android devices have stopped working since the beginning of this year for newly registered users on ACS while Notifications are being delivered to existing users on Android without any issue. Nothing changed in our code and app is in production mode.

We are using Titanium SDK 3.0.2 and MQTT. An upgrade for GCM based solution is planned and under testing and may take few weeks to release. So, looking for any quick fixes that can resolve the issue till our new release of app.
fields.summary: Push Notification Stopped Working, starting 01 Jan 14, on new android devices

comments.body:
Hello,
Support for MQTT on new devices has ben deprecated. Here is a blog post with additional details.
http://www.appcelerator.com/blog/2013/08/android-push-notification-deprecating-mqtt-in-favor-of-gcm/
